alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 13 at 11:36AM MST until August 13 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR YAVAPAI COUNTY... At 1135 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 1.75 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hyde Creek Mountain and Walnut Creek Ranger Station. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Graver Wash, Mud Tank Wash, Hyde Creek, Pine Creek, Hitt Wash, Walnut Creek, Round Valley Wash, Apache Creek, North Fork Walnut Creek, Cottonwood Canyon, South Fork Walnut Creek, Antelope Wash and Williamson Valley Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
